page.title: 16The College Grounds.
page.content: Ampleforth College has been famous for sports and has always had its rugby and cricket grounds. For rugby there are about 20 pitches. They are in groups which are called 'Colts', 'Jungle', 'Ram', 'Lion wood' and 'Brickfields'. There are 3 cricket pitches. The 2 main pitches both have pavilions: in one rests a ball used when England played Australia in 1932 which is signed by many of the players. Also in the grounds are 2 cinder tracks used for athletics. The 400 metre one is called 'Red Track' and the one around the '1st XV' rugby pitch is the 'Black Track'. There are 21 hard tennis courts which are used by the school. There is also the Saint Alban's Centre which is used for many indoor sports.
